document_name_accent: benh tac tinh mach vong mac.json
document_title: Retinal vein occlusion: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_content:
“After recovery, people with Covid-19 face the risk of systemic embolism, one of which is the risk of retinal vein occlusion with symptoms ranging from vague to clear, including blurring or loss of vision (does not cause pain) and usually occurs in one eye", MSc. Pham Huy Vu Tung - Tam Anh General Hospital, Ho Chi Minh City, shared.
Blurring or loss of vision may be mild at first, but may get worse over the next few hours or days. Sometimes complete vision loss occurs almost immediately.
If these symptoms occur, it is important that the patient see an eye specialist as soon as possible. Retinal vein occlusion often causes permanent damage to the retina, even complete loss of vision. This is also the cause of other eye problems.
subsection_title: benh tac tinh mach vong mac.json. Common symptoms
